1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: 僕の家の朝は早いです
1.english: The mornings at my house start early.

2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: 朝起きて一番に　中庭に集まって家族みんなで太極拳をします
2.english: As soon as everyone wakes up, we all gather in the yard to practice Tai Chi.

3.speaker: PANDA
3.japanese: お爺ちゃんが中国拳法の達人だからです
3.english: The reason being, my grandfather is a master of Chinese martial arts.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.japanese: 太極拳が終わったら　朝ごはんを食べます
4.english: As soon as we're done with Tai Chi, we eat breakfast.

5.speaker: PANDA MAMA
5.english: How long are you planning on sleeping?

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: 今日動物園休みなんだから　寝かせて（　^ω^）
6.english: The zoo's closed today, so let me sleep.

7.speaker: PANDA MAMA
7.japanese: みんなとっくに起きて太極拳やって　朝ごはん食べてるわよ
7.english: Everyone else has already gotten up, finished their Tai Chi, and are eating breakfast.

8.speaker: PANDA
8.japanese: 太極拳でしょう　ベッドの上でやる(*￣∇￣)ノ
8.english: Tai Chi, right? I can do that in bed.

9.speaker: PANDA MAMA
9.english: Good grief. Don't suck me up! Are you tired?

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.japanese: 最近運動不足だから　肩こちゃって
10.english: I haven't been exercising enough lately, so my shoulders are stiff.

11.speaker: PENGUIN
11.japanese: 笹子さん　ちょっと　肩もんでくれない
11.english: Could you rub my shoulders, Miss Sasako?

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.english: What's wrong? I can't seem to find your shoulders.

14.speaker: SASAKO
14.japanese: ペンギンさんの肩って　どこにあるんですか
14.english: Where exactly are your shoulders, Mr. Penguin? Huh? They're right here. Can't you tell?

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.japanese: じゃ　白熊君　肩揉んでくれる
16.english: Then could you rub my shoulders, Polar Bear? Sure.

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: 刺さってる　刺さってるw(ﾟДﾟ)w

19.speaker: PANDA
19.japanese: ペンギンさん　来てたの

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: 動物園のバイト　今日は休み
20.english: You have the day off from the zoo today? Yep. Could I get the usual, Miss Sasako?

21.speaker: SASAKO
21.english: A large serving of bamboo, coming right up.

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: 白熊君のお店　今日も人いっぱいだね
22.english: Polar Bear's café is crowded again today.

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.japanese: コーヒーも食べ物も美味しいよね
23.english: That's because the coffee and the food are excellent.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.english: It has a nice atmosphere, too.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.japanese: おしゃれな女の子がいっぱいだね
26.english: There are lots of pretty girls, too. There sure are.

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: 珍しい動物も来てるよね

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: カフェやってる白熊君って格好よくない"o((>ω< ))o"
29.english: Polar Bear is pretty cool for running a café, isn't he?

31.speaker: PANDA
31.japanese: まあ　お客でダラダラしてるペンギンさんは
31.english: However, since you're always lazing around here as a customer,

32.speaker: PANDA
32.japanese: とくには格好よくないね
32.english: you're not as cool, Mr. Penguin.

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.japanese: 僕と比べるのはやめてくれない(*′Д`)

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.japanese: あ　白熊君　カフェモカ頂戴
34.english: Oh, Polar Bear, one café mocha, please {\i1}(choudai){\i0}.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.english: That would be a low dining table {\i1}(chabudai){\i0}.

37.speaker: PENGUIN
37.english: Those would be brothers {\i1}(kyoudai){\i0}. {\i1}Please{\i0}, okay? Here you go, one café mocha.

38.speaker: PENGUIN
38.english: Couldn't you just do that from the beginning?

40.speaker: POLAR BEAR
40.japanese: 笹子さん　ちょっと出てくるね
40.english: I'm going to step out for a bit, Miss Sasako. Oh, okay, Mr. Polar Bear. Take care!

41.speaker: PANDA
41.japanese: そうだ　僕もカフェを開いてみたらどうかな
41.english: I know! What if I open up a café, too? Really? You?

44.speaker: PANDA
44.japanese: どんなカフェにしようかなぁ
44.english: I wonder what kind of café it would be.

45.speaker: PANDA
45.japanese: まったりできる　レトロなカフェがいいな
45.english: I think it should be mellow, with a retro feel.

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: うん　コンセプトは悪くないね

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.english: Please don't say that about yourself.

51.speaker: PANDA
51.japanese: お店に中にね　僕のコレクションも飾ろうかな
51.english: I think I'm going to decorate the interior with my collection.

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.japanese: パンダ君のコレクションって　パンダグッヅ
52.english: And your collection consists of panda items? Yep. They're super cute!

54.speaker: PANDA
54.english: Is there a problem? No, not really. Go on.

55.speaker: PANDA
55.japanese: 当店のおすすめは日替わり竹ランチです
55.english: Our specialty is the Daily Special Bamboo Lunch.

56.speaker: PANDA
56.japanese: お品書きはこちらです
56.english: Here's our menu. Bamboo Deluxe Special.

62.speaker: PANDA
62.japanese: ……竹定食　松　竹　梅
62.english: Bamboo Sets: Your choice of Pine, Bamboo, or Plum.

63.speaker: PENGUIN
63.japanese: ちょっと　ちょっと

64.speaker: PENGUIN
64.japanese: パンダ君の好物しかおいてないじゃない　そのカフェ
64.english: You're only serving things you like at your café.

65.speaker: PANDA
65.japanese: 僕の好きなものは　皆もきっと好きだよ
65.english: I'm sure that everyone will like the things I like.

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.english: You're not going to carry any raw fish?

68.speaker: PANDA
68.japanese: カフェに生魚はおいてないでしょう
68.english: They don't have raw fish at cafés.

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: カフェに竹なんておいてないでしょう
69.english: They don't have bamboo at cafés either.

70.speaker: PANDA
70.japanese: しろくまカフェにはおいてあるよ
70.english: They do at Polar Bear's Café.

71.speaker: PENGUIN
71.japanese: 頼むのパンダ君だけでしょう
71.english: You're the only one that orders it, though.

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.japanese: 僕はやっぱり生魚おいて欲しいね
72.english: I'd like it if you carried raw fish. Really? We do have boiled young bamboo though. That'd be a very different genre.

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.japanese: だいたいその竹定食の松　竹　梅って紛らわしいよ
74.english: Not to mention your Bamboo Sets of Pine, Bamboo, and Plum are rather confusing.

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.japanese: まあ　竹中心のメニューだと　お客さんはあんまりこないよ
76.english: You're not going to get  many customers with a menu based solely on bamboo. What? There'll be tons!

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.english: Exactly what makes you think that?

78.speaker: PANDA
78.japanese: ラマさんはパンダカフェ来てくれるよね
78.english: You'll come to Panda's Café, right, Mr. Llama?

79.speaker: LLAMA
79.japanese: 僕竹食べるとお腹痛くなっちゃうんです
79.english: I get a stomachache when I eat bamboo.

80.speaker: PANDA
80.japanese: どうしよう　ペンギンさん
80.english: What should I do, Mr. Penguin?

81.speaker: PENGUIN
81.japanese: 普通の料理も出したら
81.english: Why don't you offer some normal food, too?

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: ほら　パスタとかさあ

83.speaker: PANDA
83.english: Bamboo pasta! That's a great idea!

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.english: Er, let's leave out the bamboo?

85.speaker: PANDA
85.japanese: やってみたいなあ　パンダカフェ（～o￣▽￣)～o
85.english: I really want to open Panda's Café.

86.speaker: POLAR BEAR
86.japanese: 悪い予感がするね  ヽ(´Д`；)ﾉ
86.english: I have a bad feeling about this.

89.speaker: PANDA
89.japanese: はい　竹いっちょう
89.english: One order of bamboo coming right up!

90.speaker: PANDA
90.japanese: 大盛りもできますよ　どうしますか
90.english: We can make it a large serving if you'd like. What do you say?

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.japanese: パンダ君じゃダメだね　僕がカフェやるよ
92.english: Your idea just doesn't work, Panda. I'll open a café. What kind of café will it be?

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.japanese: そうだね　ペンギンカフェ
93.english: Let's see... I'll call it Penguin's Café. Very original.

94.speaker: PENGUIN
94.japanese: いやいや　和風のカフェなんだよ

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.japanese: メニューは　そうだな
95.english: Let's see, the menu will center around alcohol and raw fish.

96.speaker: PANDA
96.japanese: 和風カフェっていうより　お寿司屋さんみたいなメニューだね
96.english: That sounds like a menu fora sushi restaurant, not a Japanese-style café.

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.japanese: コンセプトは四季おり売りの新鮮な海の幸を
97.english: The concept will be a café where you can eat the season's freshest seafood

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.japanese: 店主が選んだ　こだわりのお酒でいただけるカフェ
98.english: along with the best sake, hand-picked by the owner.

99.speaker: PANDA
99.japanese: それカフェじゃなくて　お寿司屋さんじゃない
99.english: That's a sushi restaurantnot a café, right?

100.speaker: PENGUIN
100.english: No, it's not. Also, in the middle of the café, there'll be an aquarium.

101.speaker: PENGUIN
101.japanese: 水槽の中では魚が泳いでいて
101.english: There'll be fish swimming around in it

102.speaker: PENGUIN
102.japanese: お客さんは自分の選んだ魚を食られるの
102.english: and customers can choose which fish they want to eat. There aren't any cafés with fish tanks.

103.speaker: PANDA
103.japanese: カフェっぽさも入れてよ
103.english: You need something a café would have.

104.speaker: PENGUIN
104.japanese: カフェっぽさ　入ってない
104.english: Something a café would have?You don't get it? It's Penguin's {\i1}Café{\i0}.

106.speaker: SASAKO
106.japanese: だったら　コーヒー出したりしたらどうですか
106.english: Then, why don't you try serving coffee?

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.japanese: でも　市場まで魚の仕入れがあるかな
107.english: Well, I'd be busy getting the fish from the fish market.

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.japanese: そこまで手が回るかな
108.english: I don't know if I'd be able to handle coffee, too.

109.speaker: PANDA
109.japanese: やめちゃえば　カフェ
109.english: You might as well hang up the café idea.

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: 何言ってるの　やるよ　僕は
110.english: What are you talking about?! I'm totally going to do it!

111.speaker: PENGUIN
111.japanese: へ　いらっしゃい　o(*≧▽≦)ツ

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.japanese: 旦那　何しやしょうか(｀・ω・´)
112.english: Sir, what can I get'cha? Change everything back.

113.speaker: LLAMA
113.japanese: ラマカフェはどうですか

114.speaker: PANDA
114.english: What kind of café is it?

115.speaker: LLAMA
115.japanese: ラマがいるカフェなんですけど
115.english: It's a café with llamas in it.

116.speaker: PENGUIN
116.english: Well, that's original. Would you be able to carry the coffee? It would all depend on balance.

117.speaker: LLAMA
117.japanese: コンセプトとしては店内のラマに草をあげたり
117.english: As for the concept, it'll be a café where you can feed the llamas grass,

118.speaker: LLAMA
118.japanese: 毛繕いしたり　自由にかわいがって　いいカフェなんです
118.english: groom them, and adore them freely.

119.speaker: PENGUIN
119.english: It's like a Cat Café. You can groom the llamas. Isn't that amazing?

120.speaker: PENGUIN
120.japanese: そうかな　楽しいのそれ
120.english: I don't know. Is that actually fun? Not only that, you can pick your favorite llama and take them outside for a walk. I'll take this llama.

121.speaker: GUY
121.japanese: ありがとうございま～～す

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.japanese: ちょっと　草食べってかない
122.english: Do you want to stop to eat some grass? It needs a bit of salt.

124.speaker: PENGUIN
124.english: I'm having a hard time thinking that'd be fun.

125.speaker: PANDA
125.japanese: やっぱりパンダカフェが一番だよ
125.english: Panda's Café is the best, without a doubt.

126.speaker: PENGUIN
126.japanese: ペンギンカフェじゃない
126.english: Don't you mean Penguin's Café? Hey, what do you think, Polar Bear? Llama's Café.

130.speaker: PANDA
130.japanese: どのカフェがいいと思う
130.english: Which café do you think is the best?

133.speaker: PANDA
133.japanese: やっぱりパンダカフェだよね
133.english: I'm telling you, it's all about Panda's Café.

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.japanese: え　ペンギンカフェでしょう
134.english: What? Surely you mean Penguin's Café. No, no, it's Llama's Café. H-Hey! Please listen!

136.speaker: SASAKO
136.japanese: えーと　そうですね
136.english: Well, let's see... There's a panda-like Miss Sasako, right?

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.japanese: え　それじゃパンダカフェと変わらないじゃない
137.english: Then that wouldn't be any different from Panda's Café.

138.speaker: LLAMA
138.japanese: いえいえ　ラマっぽい笹子さんが
138.english: No, no. There's a llama-like Miss Sasako and...

140.speaker: PENGUIN
140.japanese: 僕、好きなペンギンさんが居るんだ
140.english: I have a penguin that I like.

141.speaker: LLAMA
141.japanese: すみません、抹茶パフェください
141.english: Excuse me. Could I get a green tea parfait?

142.speaker: LLAMA
142.english: And? I have a penguin that I like—

143.speaker: LLAMA
143.japanese: すみません、やっぱりいちごパフェにしてくれますか
143.english: Excuse me, could you change that to a strawberry parfait?

144.speaker: PENGUIN
144.english: Hey! Are you even listening?! Hello!

145.speaker: PANDA
145.japanese: しろくま君　いつもの
145.english: Could I get the usual, Polar Bear?

146.speaker: POLAR BEAR
146.japanese: お待ち遠様　竹大盛りね
146.english: There you go. A large serving of bamboo.

148.speaker: POLAR BEAR
148.english: Should we do it? What? A cherry blossom viewing party.

153.speaker: PENGUIN
153.japanese: 今年も綺麗に咲いたね
153.english: They blossomed amazingly again this year.

154.speaker: PANDA
154.english: I wonder what we should do for snacks...

155.speaker: PENGUIN
155.english: What an unromantic thing to say.

156.speaker: PENGUIN
156.japanese: 桜は綺麗だなって話してるんだから
156.english: We're talking about how pretty the cherry blossoms are. Hey, do you have any snacks? You're not listening at all. Oh, well.

157.speaker: LLAMA
157.japanese: 花弁って食べられますかね
157.english: I wonder if the cherry blossoms are edible.

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.japanese: もう一人情緒ないのがいるよ
158.english: And another one who doesn't get it.

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: ラマさんは草が食べられるなら　食べられるんじゃない？
159.english: You probably could, considering you eat grass, as well.

160.speaker: PANDA
160.english: Hey, do you have any bamboo?

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.japanese: お弁当なら持って来たよ
162.english: I packed a lunch for us.

163.speaker: PANDA
163.english: You're amazing, Polar Bear! I'm... going to... run some errands...

166.speaker: SLOTH
166.japanese: 何か乾き物買ってくる
166.english: a drink... at the... convenience store— It's all right, we have enough here.

167.speaker: SLOTH
167.english: It's just right over there... I'll be... right back...

171.speaker: PENGUIN
171.japanese: こんなに綺麗なのに、すぐに散っちゃうんだから
171.english: They're so beautiful, but they fall so quickly.

172.speaker: PENGUIN
172.english: It's all so fleeting. This is a new recipe I tried. Oh! It looks delicious! Thank you for the food! Hey! Stop eating and let's do something

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.japanese: もっとお花見らしいことしようよ
173.english: more fitting for a cherry blossom viewing party. More fitting for a cherry blossom viewing party? Like singing.

174.speaker: PANDA
174.english: I'm terrible at singing. Same here.

182.speaker: PANDA
182.english: Mr. Penguin is sleeping. That's not it! I'm just got tired of your stupid puns and fell over!

183.speaker: POLAR BEAR
183.japanese: ひどいなぁ、ペンギンさん
183.english: Well, that was rude, Mr. Penguin.

184.speaker: PENGUIN
184.english: You know there's more to do at these events! How about impersonations?!

185.speaker: PENGUIN
185.japanese: わ～～名倉さんの物真似でしょう
185.english: That's totally an impersonation of Mr. Nagura!

186.speaker: LLAMA
186.english: I'm just... eating. We're lacking something. I know! Polar Bear! Lift me up to that tree there! I'll fly! I don't think that's a good idea.

187.speaker: PENGUIN
187.english: Why are you trying to stop me?! Then you do it, Panda!

188.speaker: PENGUIN
188.japanese: ほら、僕を木の上に乗せて
188.english: Come on! Lift me up into the tree! I'm Llama.

189.speaker: SASAKO
189.english: He appears to be rather drunk. I think he drank too much. Wow, that's amazing!

190.speaker: PANDA
190.japanese: お花見らしくなってきたよ、ペンギンさん
190.english: It's like a real cherry blossom viewing party! Mr. Penguin?

192.speaker: SASAKO
192.english: He's totally knocked out. Hey! Don't sleep!

193.speaker: PANDA
193.english: We're awake. Young penguins these days just don't get it!

194.speaker: PENGUIN
194.japanese: 可愛いだけじゃダメなんだよ
194.english: It's not just about being cute! Am I right?!

198.speaker: PENGUIN
198.japanese: 吉崎さん、目の周りにあざがあるよ
198.english: Oh no! You have bruises around your eyes, Mr. Yoshizaki!

199.speaker: PENGUIN
199.japanese: 誰かに殴られたよ？大丈夫？
199.english: Did someone hit you? Are you okay?! This is getting annoying.

200.speaker: PENGUIN
200.english: Hey, Mr. Nagura. Are you listening?

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.japanese: 好きなペンギンがいるんだよ
203.english: I have a penguin that I like.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.japanese: パン屋のバイトのペンコさんっていうんだけど
204.english: Her name is Miss Penko and she works at the bakery part-time.

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.japanese: ペンコさん　一生僕と同じ魚を食べてください！
206.english: Please share the same fish with me for as long as we both live, Miss Penko!

209.speaker: POLAR BEAR
209.japanese: もう面白いから、見ていいよ
209.english: This is rather amusing, so I'll just watch. Jeez! W-Will you listen to what I have to say?

210.speaker: PANDA
210.english: What? I wrote a poem about Miss Penko. Really? How does it go?

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.japanese: ペンコさんが魚を食べる

215.speaker: PENGUIN
215.japanese: どうですか、ペンコさん
215.english: What do you think, Miss Penko?

217.speaker: POLAR BEAR
217.japanese: ペンギンさん、ちょっとペンコさんと散歩してきたら、
217.english: Why don't you go on a walk with Miss Penko, Mr. Penguin?

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.japanese: じゃ、行こうか、ペンコさん

222.speaker: PENGUIN
222.japanese: 二人きりのロマンチックな夜だね
222.english: It'll be a romantic evening with just the two of us.

223.speaker: PANDA
223.japanese: いろいろ違ってる気がするよ
223.english: I can't help but feel there's a lot wrong with this.

224.speaker: PENGUIN
224.japanese: いつまでもこうして歩いていたいなぁ
224.english: I wish we could walk like this forever.

225.speaker: PANDA
225.english: I want to go home. Miss Penko, will you go out with—  What?! Where did you come from, Mr. Yoshizaki?!

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.japanese: ペンコさん、どこ！ペンコさん！
227.english: Miss Penko, where did you go?! Miss Penko!

230.speaker: SLOTH
230.japanese: コンビニ行ってきたよ
230.english: I went... to the convenience store... No one's... here...

231.speaker: POLAR BEAR
231.english: The night blossoms are pretty, too.

232.speaker: PANDA
232.japanese: 昨日はびっくりしたね

234.speaker: PANDA
234.japanese: ペンギンさんって酒癖悪いね
234.english: Mr. Penguin doesn't handle  alcohol very well.

236.speaker: PENGUIN
236.english: My head is pounding for some reason.

237.speaker: PANDA
237.japanese: あれ　それでペンコさんのパン屋さんで買ったの
237.english: Oh, did you buy that from the bakery Miss Penko works at?

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.english: What?! How do you know about that?!

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.japanese: なんで僕のポエムを　なんで知ってるの
240.english: How do you know about my poem?! Why do you know about it?!

241.speaker: PANDA
241.japanese: ペンコさん　一生僕と同じ魚を食べてください
241.english: "Please share the same fish with me for as long as we both live, Miss Penko!"

242.speaker: PENGUIN
242.japanese: 僕が考えてるプロポーズの言葉！！
242.english: The words I was going to use for my proposal!

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.english: How do you know about that?!

245.speaker: PENGUIN
245.japanese: 誰にも話してないのに

248.speaker: LLAMA
248.japanese: ペンコさんが魚を食べる
248.english: "Miss Penko eats fish." Knock it off!

249.speaker: PANDA
249.japanese: ペンギンさんペンギンさん

250.speaker: PANDA
250.english: Did you have some plastic surgery done?

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.japanese: 逆に聞くけど、何でそう思った？
252.english: But let me ask, why did you think that?

253.speaker: PANDA
253.japanese: じゃ僕も逆に聞くけど
253.english: But now let me ask, what do you think {\i1}nata de coco{\i0} is made from? How did you think to ask that?

254.speaker: PENGUIN
254.japanese: しろくま君　纏めて
254.english: Could you wrap this up, Polar Bear?

255.speaker: POLAR BEAR
255.japanese: 次回のしろくまカフェは

256.speaker: POLAR BEAR
256.japanese: 実写版でお送りします　お楽しみに
256.english: will be presented in live-action. Enjoy!

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.japanese: 送らないよ　アニメだよ
257.english: No, it won't! It'll be animated.
